name: ListAuditRecords
description:
Retrieve audit trail records from PagerDuty.

Use this tool to list audit trail records from PagerDuty based on specified query parameters or default criteria. Only accessible by admins, account owners, or authorized tokens on specific pricing plans. Records are sorted by execution time, from newest to oldest. Useful for tracking changes and activities within the system.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: Specify the API version using the Accept header for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the media type for the request. Must be `application/json`.

parameters.name: record_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of audit records to return. It is either the requested limit or the API's maximum request size.

value_schema.description: The minimum of the `limit` parameter used in the request or the maximum request size of the API.

parameters.name: next_result_cursor
parameters.description: Use this to fetch the next set of results. Typically acquired from the `next_cursor` of the prior request. If not provided, it starts from the beginning of the result set.

value_schema.description: Optional parameter used to request the "next" set of results from an API.  The value provided here is most commonly obtained from the `next_cursor` field of the previous request.  When no value is provided, the request starts at the beginning of the result set.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the search range. Defaults to 24 hours ago if not specified.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now() - 24 hours` (past 24 hours)

parameters.name: end_date_range
parameters.description: Specifies the end date for the audit record search. Defaults to now if not specified and cannot exceed 31 days after the start date.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. If not specified, defaults to `now()`. May not be more than 31 days after `since`.

parameters.name: actor_type_filter
parameters.description: Specifies the type of actor to filter the audit records by. Acceptable values are 'user_reference', 'api_key_reference', or 'app_reference'.

value_schema.description: Actor type filter.

parameters.name: filter_by_actor_id
parameters.description: Filter audit records by actor ID. Requires `actor_type` to be specified.

value_schema.description: Actor Id filter. Must be qualified by providing the `actor_type` param.

parameters.name: method_type_filter
parameters.description: Specify the method type for filtering audit records. Options include 'browser', 'oauth', 'api_token', 'identity_provider', and 'other'.

value_schema.description: Method type filter.

parameters.name: method_truncated_token
parameters.description: Filter records by method truncated token. Requires 'method_type' parameter for qualification.

value_schema.description: Method truncated_token filter. Must be qualified by providing the `method_type` param.

parameters.name: action_filters
parameters.description: Filter the audit records by specific actions such as 'create', 'update', or 'delete'.

value_schema.description: Action filter
